alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:14PM EST until December 19 at 12:44PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Waterbury affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Waterbury. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 417.0 feet, The Winooski from Waterbury downstream through Richmond will be at bankful. Some minor flooding of low lying fields will occur. At 419.0 feet, Water will flood fields behind the Vermont State Office Complex in Waterbury. Field flooding will occur from Waterbury downstream through Richmond. At 421.0 feet, In Waterbury, high water will encroach properties on Randall Street, Foundry Street and Route 2 crossing Thatcher Brook. Rowe Field will flood. High water will also approach low lying parking lots at the Waterbury State Office Complex. Downstream in Richmond, Bridge Street near the Round Church and the public park will begin to flood. Considerable field flooding will occur from Waterbury downstream through Richmond. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 420.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Monday was 420.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 421.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 419.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 419.9 feet on 04/15/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.
